Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
CAN: Attempt to draw a plant with a basic shape and some features like a stem and leaves (student has a basic idea of what a plant looks like).
Draw random elements that might represent sunlight or water (such as a sun or scribbles) next to the plant without clear connection.
CANNOT: Clearly differentiate between a healthy and unhealthy plant (student might draw all plants looking similar without details showing health).
Illustrate recognizable effects of lack of water (plant wilting) or lack of light (plant stretching towards light) (student lacks understanding of how these factors affect plants).
Consistently label parts of the plant drawing (e.g., student may not label at all or use incorrect labels).
Show a pattern in the drawings that indicates a plant's dependence on water and light (student might not understand the relationship between water/light and growth).
